title: Jäger 2016 Ried Achleiten Smaragd Riesling (Wachau)
description: Sun-ripened Mirabelle plum and bright lemon zest notes make up this wine's juicy but fresh nose. The palate backs the fruit with textured zestiness and wonderfully forward lemon freshness. It's taut, concentrated and streamlined, its pure lemon notes echoing forever. Gorgeous now but with real potential. Drink 2018–2030.

title: Johanneshof Reinisch 2015 Holzspur Pinot Noir (Thermenregion)
description: The merest touch of earthy, tarry smoke plays on the closed nose. The body presents a more generous picture of juicy, ripe plum and blackberry fruit, aided by fresh acidity and a finely woven tannic structure. This brims with ripe fruit and is already approachable, but it will develop its alluring aromatics even more.

title: Jurtschitsch 2016 Ried Heiligenstein Riesling (Kamptal)
description: A pure note of lemon blossom paves the way for wet earth, tart green apple, citrus foliage and lemon scents in this wine. The palate is similarly ethereal, presenting tender lemon notes against an earthier background. This is all done with an admirably light touch, which suits this linear, taut, dry Riesling well. It's lovely now but will be far more intriguing with some bottle age. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Lapostolle 2013 Clos Apalta Limited Release Estate Bottled Red (Colchagua Valley)
description: Right away, aromas of spicy black fruits, balsam wood, clove and earth announce a special wine of extra high quality. In the mouth, this is ripe and concentrated (even for a cool year) and ideally balanced. Dark oaky spicy blackberry flavors finish flush, toasty and loaded. Drink through 2028.
designation: Clos Apalta Limited Release Estate Bottled

title: Markus Altenburger 2015 Blaufränkisch (Leithaberg)
description: Plum and blackberry notes have a touch of smoke and mocha notes, which mellow on the taut palate. This shows lovely tension between ample fruit and taut freshness, with fine tannins giving a pleasant gauze-like structure. There is warmth and power but both are well contained and held on a tight leash. This shows that well-toned muscle takes you further than mere weight. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Markus Altenburger 2015 Ried Gritschenberg Blaufränkisch (Leithaberg)
description: An almost maple syrup-like richness comes with the first whiff of cherry fruit on the nose. Similar, more game-like aromatics continue on the concentrated palate that is packed tightly, almost neatly with fruit and fine tannin. This seems compact, with a fine but firm grip. Let it relax for a while, then enjoy its crunchy red-cherry freshness. Drink 2020–2028.

title: Markus Huber 2016 Ried Berg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)
description: A zesty lemon note pervades this wine's lovely Russet pear peel scents. The palate has an equally lithe and elegant feel. The midpalate texture is like taut and delicate lace. Everything is there, but in filigree. The finish is really lip-smacking and fresh.

title: Netzl 2015 Anna-Christina Red (Carnuntum)
description: The nose wants to give away little but the palate is more forthcoming: red cherry is ripe and crunchy. Firm, structured tannins hold notions of vanilla and pepper while vivid, welcome freshness pervades the entire palate. This is elegant and will come into its own with some bottle age. The ripe but tart cherry leaves a lasting impression on the dry finish. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Pichler-Krutzler 2016 Ried Kellerberg Riesling (Wachau)
description: Citrus foliage and tangerine zest notes play softly on the nose of this wine. The palate fizzes quietly, like a toned-down lemon sherbet. Everything shows that this is a very young wine with great concentration and potential. The lemon note captures the slender, linear palate and creates a lip-smacking finish. Drink 2018–2030.

title: Proidl 2016 Ried Ehrenfels Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)
description: Sun-warmed hay, gentle pear and ripe lemon notes make for a quietly aromatic nose in this wine. That same harmonised touch is also apparent on the almost-creamy palate. Deep, savory citrus pith and hay tones create an understated backdrop for the lovely, gentle fruit. Very elegant from start to finish.

title: Proidl 2016 Ried Hochäcker Riesling (Kremstal)
description: Mellow yet ripe russet pear notes are spiked with lemon freshness on the nose of this wine. That wonderful and enticing contrast continues on the palate, where the juicy, rounded ripeness of pear and the brisk streak of lemon gain control alternatingly. It makes for exciting, refreshing and joyful drinking. The finish is brisk, clean, lasting and dry. Drink 2018–2028.

title: Proidl 2016 Ried Pfenningberg Riesling (Kremstal)
description: Mango and passion fruit notes put a rich, tropical spin on the nose of this wine. The palate, on the other hand, offers zesty lemon and salty stone flavors and yeasty texture. Altogether, this makes for a complex, refreshing and captivating wine that sings with concentrated fruit and zestiness. The finish rings long with pure, zesty lemon. Drink 2018–2030.

title: Quartz Reef 2014 Bendigo Estate Hielo y Fuego Pinot Noir (Central Otago)
description: Made for the long haul from one of Otago's most highly respected winemakers, Rudi Bauer, this is drinking well now, offering up a heady mix of raisiny red currants, florals, soy sauce, mushrooms and tree sap. It's medium to full bodied, with a line of focused acidity amidst dusty tannins and a long, cumin and herbal finish. Drink now–2027.

title: Salomon-Undhof 2016 Ried Kögl Reserve Riesling (Kremstal)
description: A touch of yeast still mixes with the clean citrus zest notes on the nose of this wine. On the palate, that leesiness cushions the uncompromising pure lemon freshness. It's concentrated in body and dry, vivid and brisk in its flavors, with a stucture that will keep it delightful until 2030, if not longer. Rejoice in the lip-smacking finish.

title: Shafer 2015 TD-9 Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a new offering from the producer, sparked by winemaker Elias Fernandez's desire to make a Merlot-based blend, rather than a varietal Merlot. It is an estate-grown blend of 56% Merlot, 28% Cabernet Sauvignon and 16% Malbec. Rich and concentrated, it's delightfully robust and vibrant, offering a mix of blackberry, blueberry and caramel chocolate flavors that finish in soft, integrated oak.

title: Tegernseerhof 2016 Ried Steinertal Smaragd Riesling (Wachau)
description: A slight touch of flinty reduction accents this wine's fresh lemon zest notes, hinting at how very young it is. These qualities also pervade the taut, linear palate but have an earthier, textured edge. The finish recalls pure lemon zest and has a clean, lip-smacking finale. Drink 2019–2030.

title: Undurraga 2014 Altazor Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Ripe, heady aromas of cassis, raisin and spice cake hold nothing back but aren't overdone. The palate is staunch in feel, with firm but manageable tannins, while this tastes of plum, berry fruits and tomato touched by savory oak. The full yet tight finish offers plenty of balance. Drink through 2025.

title: Wohlmuth 2015 Ried Hochsteinriegl Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)
description: A bright spike of lemon precedes the mossy, green freshness and elderflower notes on the nose of this wine. The palate remains slender but has a creamy, bright edge and a more substantial, textured core. Its central well of passion fruit flavor has yet to unfold. Wait for this; it will be lovely. Drink 2020–2028.

title: Wohlmuth 2016 Ried Steinriegl Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)
description: A subtle hint of passion fruit, fresh lime and lemon, a green, mossy backdrop and a whiff of elderflower: this Sauvignon Blanc's aromas are drawn tenderly. The palate is exquisitely svelte, concentrated, full-flavored and fresh. The lasting, pure finish reveals a superbly tart and appetizing passion fruit-laden intensity.

title: Alzinger 2016 Ried Loibenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)
description: This wine's pure notes of ripe green pear send enticing signals. The palate adds zesty lemon and floral woodruff touches, creating a green cloud of aroma that fills nose and palate. It's slender and taut in body, its salty midpalate texture beautifully pervaded by citrus brightness. The finish is moreish and totally lip-smacking.

title: Alzinger 2016 Ried Loibenberg Smaragd Riesling (Wachau)
description: A heady, tropical touch of passion fruit clings to the more forward citrus notes on the nose of this wine. Lemon and tangerine notes play on the svelte, linear palate. This is totally refreshing and enlivening, with an almost electric lemon verve. Lovely now; sure to evolve. Drink 2018–2030.

title: Artner 2015 Kirchweingarten Blaufränkisch (Carnuntum)
description: That salty-sweet aspect of maple syrup makes a brief appearance on the nose before plum, nutmeg and vanilla take over. The body is smooth with elastic but present tannins, the fruit is dense and plush while ample freshness gives both harmony and crunch. It is just on the finish that some alcoholic heat becomes apparent in this very approachable but sophisticated, international style. This is big and bold but brimming with fine fruit. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Concha y Toro 2015 Don Melchor Puente Alto Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Puente Alto)
description: It's been a long time since Concha y Toro has put out a Don Melchor Cabernet with this much concentration and overall quality. An earthy nose with foresty berry aromas and generous but controlled oak sets up a fully stacked palate that's chewy but not fiercely tannic. Dark toasty chocolaty black-fruit flavors finish with a note of cherry cough drop and moderate acidity that says this is more or less ready now. Drink through 2025.

title: Daou 2015 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)
description: Quite dark in the glass, this bottling shows hearty black fruit, peppercorn and a touch of asphalt. Classic Cabernet Franc flavors show through the richness of the palate, with notes of crushed pepper and loamy soil playing up against a boysenberry backdrop.

title: Château de Saint-Cosme 2014 Hominis Fides  (Gigondas)
description: The Hominis Fides represents some of the estate's oldest Grenache vines, with an average age of 90 years. Irresistibly ripe, rich and mouthfilling, this is a powerhouse of black-plum and cherry flavors refined by layers of pencil shavings, cedar and spice. It's bold and lavishly textured yet has freshness and a fine, filigreed tannin structure. Drink now through 2030.

title: Carlisle 2015 The Derivative White (Sonoma County)
description: This is yet another stellar vintage of this unique blend, a mix of Muscadelle, Sémillon, Colombard and Palomino. Floral as a garden brimming in gardenia, it's dry and gravelly, with distinct flavors of quince and melon. Light on its feet, it's well worth seeking.

title: Charles Smith 2014 King Coal Stoneridge Vineyard Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: A blend of 80% Cabernet Sauvignon and 20% Syrah, the aromas draw you into the glass, with light notes of savory herb, cassis, pipe tobacco, spice and crushed rock. It brings a flat-out gorgeous sense of texture, covering the palate from end to end with cherry flavors that glide on the finish. The feel is knee-buckling. Best after 2021.

title: Eder 2016 Ried Süssenberg Smaragd Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)
description: Fragrant ripe apricot notions hover above the pear and herb base notes of the nose of this wine. On the concentrated palate, they add smooth fluidity to the yeasty, salty, herb-tinged texture. Pure lemon freshness adds welcome and beautiful brightness, making it slender, precise and utterly delicious.

title: Eichinger 2016 Ried Gaisberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: The appetizing brightness of freshly cut Conference pear engages upon first sniff. The palate then brings a yeasty riff that goes hand-in-hand with luminous lemon flavors, presenting a harmonious balance of lasting savory, creamy and fruity flavors. This shows immense poise and purity.

title: HammerSky 2014 The Party Estate Grown Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Merlot and 25% Petit Verdot is all about richness, starting with aromas of vanilla, caramel, milk chocolate, licorice and black-currant crème brûlée. Soft and plush on the palate, the butterscotch, candied blueberry and black plum-syrup flavors are laid across slices of hot spice cake and lifted by mulling spices.
